Articles.Content:
Hi guys! Just have an idea of making a Kerbol System using the Powder Toy.

So I went to work immediately and right now I've finished the Inner Planets of the Kerbol System. (Not necessary all of the planets when zoomed in --- I've only finished Kerbin and its moons.)

So here are some screenshots:

Kerbol System (Inner Planets):

Kerbin and its moons:

Hope you enjoy!

(BTW: Which prefix does it goes? I'm stuck between Artwork, Animation, and Special.)

Edited July 15, 2013 by Designer225
Dunno. You named Eve 'Gilly'. Just making sure you notice your fail.

Dunno. You named Eve 'Gilly'. Just making sure you notice your fail.

Whoops. Sorry.

EDIT: Uploaded a new picture. I really need to focus and make sure to correct the mistakes.

Edited July 14, 2013 by Designer225

Does powder toy simulate gravity?

Yeah, usually it is vertical, but pressing "w" (as long as there's no stickman 2 --- the squared figure with blue legs) will change the gravity setting. It will change from Vertical, off, radial, and repeating. But with Newtonian Gravity enabled, you can simulate gravity with black hole, white hole, and other stuff. Experimenting helps, though.

I'm using GPMP (I think) to hold Kerbol's particles together.

I'm using GPMP (I think) to hold Kerbol's particles together.

Moderately heated Gravity Pump(GPMP as you thought).

it changes gravity output dependent on temperature.
Kerbin looks like something that has 6 letters that starts with letter G and ends with letter E. Minus the hands on the side.
Yeah... sorry about the body shape. I'm not a professional in playing the Powder Toy. Mostly I just mess around, but made an exception to this case. Sorta.

This powder toy game looks like the sandbox game ive always wanted now I won't have to deal with regular falling sand games!

Is this game free?

This powder toy game looks like the sandbox game ive always wanted now I won't have to deal with regular falling sand games!

Is this game free?

It's free. There's a beta in the Powder Toy game page, and although you can get to access (and test) the beta, you can't publish it.
